org.jtrim.swing.access

Class ComponentDecorator

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jtrim.swing.access.ComponentDecorator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AccessChangeAction
    Deprecated. 
    You should rely on AutoDisplayState instead.

    Defines an AccessChangeAction implementation which decorates a Swing component if the associated group of right becomes unavailable. The component is required to be a JLayer or top level window having a root pane.

    The ComponentDecorator decorates the component using its glass pane. That is, when the associated group of rights becomes unavailable, it will replace the glass pane of the components with the one provided to the ComponentDecorator at construction time (by a factory class).

    When you expect that usually the group of right is only unavailable for a very short period of time, it is possible to define a two kinds of decorations ComponentDecorator. One to apply immediately after the group of rights becomes unavailable and one after a specified time elapses and the group of rights is still unavailable. This is useful to prevent flickering if the group of rights becomes available within the specified time (that is, if the glass pane set up immediately does not have a visual effect).

    Note that if the glass pane which is to be set by the ComponentDecorator can have the focus (as defined by the method Component.isFocusable()) and the component decorated by the ComponentDecorator has the focus (or one of its subcomponents), the focus will be moved to the newly set glass pane (if possible).

    Thread safety

    The onChangeAccess may only be called from the AWT event dispatch thread. Therefore, the AccessManager governing the rights must be set to use an executor which submits tasks to the AWT event dispatch thread (or wrap the ComponentDecorator in an AccessChangeAction which makes sure that the onChangeAccess method does not get called on an inappropriate thread).

    Synchronization transparency

    Methods of this class are not synchronization transparent.

    @Deprecated
public final class ComponentDecorator
extends java.lang.Object
implements AccessChangeAction
    See Also:
    AccessAvailabilityNotifier

    • Constructor Detail

      • ComponentDecorator

        public ComponentDecorator(javax.swing.RootPaneContainer window,
                  DecoratorPanelFactory decorator)
        Deprecated. 
        Creates a new ComponentDecorator decorating a window. The passed component must inherit from (directly or indirectly) Component.

        Using this constructor, whenever the checked group of rights becomes unavailable, the glass pane for the specified window will be set to the JPanel created by the decorator without any delay.

        Parameters:
        window - the window to be decorated. This argument cannot be null and must subclass Component.
        decorator - the DecoratorPanelFactory which defines the panel to be used as a glass pane for the window. This argument cannot be null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassCastException - if the passed argument is not an instance of Component
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any of the passed argument is null

      • ComponentDecorator

                  DelayedDecorator decorator)
        Deprecated. 
        Creates a new ComponentDecorator decorating a window. The passed component must inherit from (directly or indirectly) Component.
        Parameters:

        decorator - the DelayedDecorator which defines the panels to be used as a glass pane for the window. This argument cannot be null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassCastException - if the passed argument is not an instance of Component
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any of the passed argument is null

      • ComponentDecorator

        public ComponentDecorator(javax.swing.JLayer<?> component,
                  DecoratorPanelFactory decorator)
        Deprecated. 
        Creates a new ComponentDecorator decorating a specific component. The passed JLayer must contain the component to be decorated.

        Using this constructor, whenever the checked group of rights becomes unavailable, the glass pane for the specified JLayer will be set to the JPanel created by the decorator without any delay.

        Parameters:
        component - the component to be decorated. This argument cannot be null.
        decorator - the DecoratorPanelFactory which defines the panel to be used as a glass pane for the JLayer component. This argument cannot be null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any of the passed argument is null

        Deprecated.

        Specified by:
